$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have cataracts.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

###Cataracts in 1 eye

You don't need to tell DVLA as long as you don't have a medical condition in the other eye.

###After removal of cataracts

If you've had surgery to remove cataracts, you'll need to meet the ['visual standards for driving'](/driving-eyesight-rules "Driving eyesight rules").

$D[Download 'VIS1- Vision information' (PDF, 209K)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065298.pdf "VIS1- Vision information leaflet "){:rel="external"}$D


###Cataracts in both eyes

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1 and send it to them. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘V1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 253KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA if you have cataracts in 1 or both eyes. Fill in form V1V and send it to them. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘V1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you have cataracts - if you do, download the correct form to let them know
title: Cataracts and driving
